db:abstract.db:para: A QML application that demonstrates how to render a scene in Qt 3D.

db:article.db:para: Simple demonstrates how to render a scene in Qt 3D.

db:section.db:title: Running the Example
db:section.db:para: To run the example from Qt Creator, open the Welcome mode and select the example from Examples. For more information, see Qt Creator: Tutorial: Build and run.

db:section.db:title: Setting Up the Scene
db:section.db:para: We set up the entire scene in the main.qml file.
To be able to use the types in the Q3D and Q3D Render modules, we must import the modules:
The first entities we create are a Camera, which represents the camera used for the final rendering, and a camera controller, which allows us to control this camera using the keyboard or the mouse:
